page.title: 01Kilbucho Glen near Biggar
page.content: Northern part of southern uplands. SE of Biggar. Pleasant rural open, undulating, mostly treeless countryside. Main feature abroad glaciated valley with smooth-topped hills around 400 metres. Highest point goosland hill 435m at Triangulation Pillar. Other named hills - Hartree Hills, cow Castle, White and Mitchell Hill. Region boundary of Strathclyde and borders Regions runs through west side, main land in latter region. Sheep breeding area but cultivated fields patch work. The valley below the heather clad hills, with cattle much in evidene on lower slopes. Main communication by minor road running E to W along north side of valley. Small stream,, Kilbjucho burn runs in valley bottom. Footpath only in smaller southerly valley from Mitchell Hill farm to Cow
